raw_data.title: Project Manager FICAM
raw_data.description:
Project managers must possess the ability to manage major complex technical projects;
- Direct managerial/supervisory experience in managing major technical projects, planning, budgeting.
- Extensive experience with the following areas: system estimating and layout design, major access control
& security management system, intrusion detection, perimeter security, biometric identification, badge identification
systems, gate systems, communications and data system configuration, video systems design, fire alarm systems,
automatic sprinkler systems, fire pumps, fire detections, and CO2. Working directly with CSEIP-certified staff.
- Extensive experience with security technologies projects, involving the following: design; procurement;
logistics; technical support of complex integrated electronic/electrical systems; installation of electronic security
systems, information systems, or other systems identified as PECSS programs technical areas.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution:
A Bachelor of Science (BS) in Electrical, Computer, Communications, and/or Mechanical
Engineering from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience in the security and surveillance field. In lieu of a degree, ten years of experience in the surveillance field is acceptable.
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: a minimum of three industry manufacturer certifications in CCTV, access control and intrusion alarms. (Accepted manufacturers include AMAG, Avigilon, Bosch, Genetec.)
raw_data.key_words: Cat Sub-cat Human Capital,Compensation and Benefits,Human Resources

labor_categories.years_experience:
A Bachelor of Science (BS) in Electrical, Computer, Communications, and/or Mechanical
Engineering from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience in the security and surveillance field. In lieu of a degree, ten years of experience in the surveillance field is acceptable.

raw_data.title: Senior Engineer CSEIP
raw_data.description:
System estimating and layout design,
major access control & security management system, intrusion detection, perimeter security, biometric
identification, badge identification systems, gate systems, communications and data system configuration, video
systems design, access control systems, legacy equipment, etc. Working within CSEIP and FICAM guidelines
- Maintain client interaction to determine requirements for the initial design, managing start-up of
system/test acceptance, keeping the client posted on design progress, presenting problems and recommending
solutions.
- Assist with the supervision of and directing efforts of technicians.
raw_data.education_and_experience_substitution: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university.
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: a minimum of three industry manufacturer certifications in CCTV, access control and intrusion alarms. (Accepted manufacturers include AMAG, Avigilon, Bosch, Genetec.)
raw_data.key_words: Cat Sub-cat Human Capital,Compensation and Benefits,Human Resources

labor_categories.years_experience: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university.

raw_data.title: Security Technician
raw_data.description:
Security Technicians are responsible for the installation and maintenance of surveillance/cctv systems, access control systems, alarms, monitors and all supporting systems. They must possess: -Extensive and thorough knowledge of the principles of surveillance, access control and their electronic components.
- Extensive and demonstrated knowledge of the maintenance, overhaul, troubleshooting, and/or testing of access control and surveillance systems.
- Interpreting & working from blueprints, drawings, technical manuals, handbooks and other technical
documentation and ability to evaluate and correct technical problems.
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: a minimum of three industry manufacturer certifications in CCTV, access control and intrusion alarms. (Accepted manufacturers include AMAG, Avigilon, Bosch, Genetec.)
raw_data.key_words: Cat Sub-cat Human Capital,Compensation and Benefits,Human Resources
